etymology.description: 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") = indoors with sound -> direction towards which something is directed
etymology.interpretation: The character 向(向) (xiàng, "towards") combines 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") and 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") to suggest the idea of a sound or attention being directed towards a certain point or direction within an enclosed space. This reflects the concept of orientation or facing a direction.

examples.chinese: 我向老师请教(我向老師請教)。
examples.pinyin: wǒ xiàng lǎo shī qǐng jiào
